author: Rick_Weijers
title: Sad and bad
review: It's not a great set. I really thought I would like it, but the instructions (via app) don't work, and your phone gets heated really quickly. You also can't go back easy in the app when you change to another app in the meantime. The pieces are OK and some are very nice. But the build isn't complete. You have to use your own imagination, but meh. I would recommend buying something else.

author: slosha69
title: A Breath of Fresh Air
review:
In an age of glorified model kits, this set is truly a breath of fresh air. I spent more time fiddling around with my own designs than following the instructions. That's a first for me since getting back into LEGO as an adult. I truly felt like I was 'playing with LEGO' rather than just mindlessly following instructions. LEGO has something special here, and I hope this line continues.

The value here is good, especially at the $32 I paid. You get a decent starting point with the ship, and the bonus builds at the end of each mission were a nice touch. There's a great selection of extra parts to do as you please. I loved seeing some parts that I haven't seen since I was a kid, particularly the two different types of boosters.

The minifigures are simply amazing. I have the full wave of recent space sets currently unbuilt, so it was nice to get some extras here. I like them so much, I might just get another copy of this set just for them.

While I can see the appeal of using the app for kids, there really should at least be PDF instructions or a physical booklet. Not everyone has access to or wants to use a tablet or smartphone and more options are always better. But for me, the app was mildly entertaining.
